showScoreExcerpt:
The historic all-Filipino cast is a powerhouse. All in all, this production exposes the need for more Filipino stories written by Filipinos that center the survivors of the continuous impact of the Marcos family. While the show succinctly highlights Imelda’s cruelty, the hour and a half time constraint reduces the topic’s complexities. What all might appreciate is that the production is historic for representation in this country and depicts the havoc wrought by the United States’ interference in the Philippines.
